Activity: Log in to the system, check emails, and respond to urgent messages. Briefly review the weekly goals: 'Develop software modules for trade execution.', 'Develop software modules for data analysis.', 'Test and debug the software modules.' Prioritize tasks based on dependencies and complexity.

Review existing code related to trade execution modules to understand the current implementation and identify potential areas for improvement or integration. Refer to the software architecture documentation provided by @larch-1.

Start designing the trade execution module. Define the key functions, classes, and interfaces. Consider error handling, logging, and performance optimization. Begin drafting code structure (skeleton).
Implement the basic framework for the trade execution module. Focus on connecting to the brokerage API (simulated or test environment initially) and placing simple market orders. Use Python.
Continue implementing the trade execution module, adding support for limit orders and stop-loss orders.  Pay close attention to handling API rate limits and error responses.
Implement logging for trade execution events. Include details like order ID, price, quantity, status, and timestamps.  This will be crucial for debugging and auditing later.
Initial testing of the trade execution module in a simulated environment.  Focus on verifying order placement, cancellation, and status updates. Fix any immediately apparent bugs.
Document the trade execution module design and implementation.  Include API usage, error codes, and known limitations.
End of day. Prepare for tomorrow's tasks.
